newsitem.title: USA: Plains fed cattle market slow at $72 - feedlot.
newsitem.headline: Plains fed cattle market slow at $72 - feedlot.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle markets Friday were extremely slow, with light sales reported at $72.00 per cwt, steady with this week's busy trading, feedlot sources said.
Sales were reported on 100 slaughter steers and 300 heifers in the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma area following a weekly movement of 75,300 head, according to USDA.
No sales were reported in Kansas, but 89,000 head were confirmed for the week to date including 17,400 head or about 20 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle.
Most of this week's showlist sold including a large number of cattle on feed 85 to 100 days instead of the normal 110 to 120 days, the feedlot sources said.
Prices were underpinned by a tight number of cattle on feedlots that graded choice because they have not been on feed long, market sources said.
Feedlot cattle prices also were supported by strong beef demand the past few weeks and expectations for continued strength next week, they said.
